title: Ant and Dec halt BGT: The Champions mid-final to launch new mental health campaign
text:

Ant McPartlin and Dec Donnelly encouraged Britain's Got Talent: The Champions viewers to take a minute to speak with their loved ones as part of a new mental wellness campaign.

The hosts stopped the show halfway through the final, confirming they were going to "pause" proceedings for a minute.

Ant and Dec then revealed they were using the platform to introduce viewers to ITV's new mental health campaign, Britain Get Talking.

They urged the importance of ditching distractions including phones and television for just a short amount of time, to get people talking about how they were really feeling.

(Image: ITV)

Ant began: "Right, pay attention everyone and that includes you lot at home, because we've got something important to tell you."

Dec continued: "We'd like to introduce the new ITV campaign for mental wellness, right here on Britain's Got Talent tonight.

"In the last 15 years, there has been a staggering 48% rise in anxiety and depression amongst British children. But something as simple as talking together and listening together can build our mental wellness."

(Image: ITV)

Ant added: "Now we all know that these days, there are more distractions than ever because we're looking at the telly, or we're looking at our phones, but it's so important for our mental wellbeing to remember to get together with people we care about and talk."

Bringing BGT to a halt, Dec then revealed they would be taking a minute out of the show to encourage those watching to speak with those they were with.

He said: "So, right now, we're gonna try something that's never been done before. It's called Britain Get Talking.

(Image: ITV)

"To help Britain Get Talking, we're gonna pause this show to make time for everyone there at home to get together and just talk. So whatever you need to do, grab the kids, wake dad up, or just turn and talk to a mate because we're pausing BGT for a minute so you can talk."

The hosts, judges and audience then sat in silence for the duration, while some were shown talking to one another and even hugging one another. Crew members were also shown holding signs with encouraging words written on.

As Ant brought the show back to normal, Simon Cowell gave the boys and the campaign a standing ovation, while they thanked the crowd for cooperating.

Britain's Got Talent returns in 2020.
description: Britain's Got Talent: The Champions hosts Ant and Dec 'paused' the final to introduce ITV's new mental wellness campaign, Britain Get Talking
